task.title: Cleaning your fruit bat
task.shortdesc: Ensure your bat stays clean and healthy.

taskbody.prereq: Ensure that you have a supply of ACME Bat Shampoo on hand.
taskbody.context: Fruit bats are as fastidious about cleanliness as is a house cat. But sometimes your bat will need a bath, just as a house cat occasionally does.

step.cmd: Start filling your bathtub with warm water.
step.info: Ensure the temperature is 32 degrees Celsius (83 Fahrenheit).

step.cmd: Use your ACME Bat Catcher to locate and apprehend your bat.
step.info: You can also use a tennis racquet or a hammock made with thick string (not rope!). Your results may be less than satisfactory; you may break a few table lamps or vases.

substep.cmd: Grasp the bat-catcher by the handle.
Wait for the bat to fly by, and snatch it out of the air.
substep.info: If your spouse is laughing hysterically at this point, be patient; you probably do look a little silly.

step.cmd: If your tub has overflowed, you have some choices:

chrow.chdesc: Go find a mop and bucket. Clean up the mess.

chrow.choption: Want to wait until after the bat's bath?
chrow.chdesc: Just turn off the water and clean up later. No doubt more water will get on the floor in the next several steps.

step.cmd: Gently introduce your bat to the water.
Wash your bat, being careful not to get water in its ears.
step.info: Use the shampoo sparingly. Remember to lather, rinse, and repeat.

step.cmd: Dry your bat with a towel and hair dryer.
step.info: Having a wet bat flying around your house, probably squeaking and mad at this point, can often be an unpleasant experience. The IBM Speech to Speech Translator will help you understand what your bat is squeaking.
